bug.author: jovany-wang
bug.summary: Failed to execute `state.task_table()` when running a Java App
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>System information</denchmark-h>
OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): MBP 10.11.6 Ray installed from (source or binary): from source/current master Ray version: Python version:python3.6.5 Exact command to reproduce:
<denchmark-h:h3>Describe the problem</denchmark-h>
Run a Java actor example
RayActor<Counter> actor = Ray.createActor(ActorTest::factory, 1); Assert.assertNotEquals(actor.getId(), UniqueId.NIL); // Test calling an actor Assert.assertEquals(Integer.valueOf(1), Ray.call(Counter::getValue, actor).get());
TimeUnit.SECONDS.sleep(100000);
run this scirpt to get task list from GCS:
from ray.experimental import state
gs = state.GlobalState() gs._initialize_global_state("127.0.0.1", 6379)
print(gs.task_table()) them we got this error: _pickle.UnpicklingError: invalid load key, '\xf7'.
The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "demo.py", line 6, in <module> print(gs.task_table()) File "/Users/wangqing/Workspace/ray/python/ray/experimental/state.py", line 367, in task_table ray.ObjectID(task_id_binary)) File "/Users/wangqing/Workspace/ray/python/ray/experimental/state.py", line 320, in _task_table "Args": task_spec.arguments(), SystemError: <built-in method arguments of task.Task object at 0x117f22690> returned a result with an error set I added some logs to trace it, and found thatï¼š function at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/blob/master/src/ray/raylet/lib/python/common_extension.cc#L597>this line</denchmark-link> returns a NULL. That means the arg failed. PS: If I run a python actor example, then run the script, I will get correct result.
